title: Daily Discussion Post - March 15 | Questions, images, videos, comments, unconfirmed reports, theories, suggestions
text: I wonder if this has been going on longer than we knew about...Around Christmas my entire family + my best friend and her family all got really sick with what we were all calling the worst cold we've ever had. Just about two weeks in when I thought I was getting better, all the sudden I started spiking a fever of 102 and had a really dry cough and a hard time breathing. It got bad enough that I went to urgent care (which I never do, but I was literally sicker than I've ever been) and when I told the doctor my symptoms, he said it was probably bronchitis and there wasn't much he could do. It was really bad for about a week, and then there was another week of still feeling terrible and ultra fatigued but no fever. No matter how many decongestants I took, I couldn't cough anything up. And then when it went away, it just...went away. I never coughed anything up, my lungs just stopped being inflamed and I could breathe better. I didn't have the lingering cough that I've had in the past with bronchitis. In fact, it was worse than any bronchitis I've ever had.    I didn't really give this much second thought during this current outbreak other than "fuck, last time a cold did me so bad that this shit might kill me", but a friend shared something on twitter that was suggesting that there has been a spike in what were originally thought to be flu cases even all the way back to December, and that there is thought that some of these could've been COVID-19 cases that we didn't know about. It has me thinking now, especially because my best friend (who was the first to get sick) started a new job last summer that had her flying around the country twice a week every other week.   Is it possible that this virus has already been in America for a few months and we weren‚Äôt aware because there isn‚Äôt a lot of testing going on?

text: Right, lets try this again, with most of the world consumed by hysteria and panic buying how long can farmers support this. Warehouses are already feeling it as Amazon is sold out of tp of all things. How long before other items can not be supplied. You can only grow canned vegetables so fast, animals only grow so fast. China didnt have as much problem as they are essentially the initial nation. They have other countries to lean on, now governments are focused on keeping their own people safe and likely arent willing to send desperatly needed resources. So again, how long before supplies run out. Thats when the collapse starts. Civil unrest will start sooner if people are forced out of their homes and cant pay their bills due to potential long term quaratine. Thats why this is a real possibility. China is holding medicine hostage so how long will pharmacies last since they supply most medicines for some unkown reason.
